intro: Casearia seethalakshmiae, commonly known as the Seethalakshmi casearia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, berry-like structures that turn red when mature. The species is named in honor of the Indian saint and poet Seethalakshmi, reflecting its cultural significance in the region.
